comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: 8th Rifle Brigade 24/8/17 During the night of the 23rd/24th the 8th Rifle Brigade, at Zillebeke Bund, was expecting relief by the 8th Bn. 60th and only two and a half companies arrived. . . . At 1.10 p.m. orders were received for all troops at the Bund to reinforce the original front line. Accordingly, Colonel Prideaux-Brune took up the composite battalion to report to O.C 10th Bn. D.L.I. at Clapham Junction. The move was made through an intense barrage and 2nd Lieutenant W.W. Wines was killed, Captain B.H. Bennett, 2nd Lieutenant T.D. England and about forty ranks being wounded. . . . 1914-1918.invisionzone.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=80827

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Captain Basil Hastings Bennett Born on 10 June 1894, the second son of Herbert Bennett Educated at Charterhouse School from Long Quarter 1909 to Summer 1913 and at Magdalen College, Oxford University Enlisted in K Company, the Inns of Court OTC on 30 November 1914 Commissioned in the Royal Engineers on 29 January 1915 Served in the Great War as a Captain, 8th Bn, The Rifle Brigade Three times wounded in action. Employed with the Ministry of Munitions during the later part of the Great War. In 1922 he married Cecily Ynys, daughter of Rex Howell of Esher. His address in 1934 was Ford's Farm, Pirbright, Surrey In 1966 he was living at 37 Duke Street, St. James, London, SW 1 Sources: Charterhouse Register 1872-1931; Charterhouse in London, 1921; The Magdalen College Record, 1934; The Magdalen College Record, 1966; The Inns of Court O. T. C. during the Great War. 1914-1918.invisionzone.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=790... The Magdalen College Record Bennett, Basil Hastings ; b. June 10, 1894 ; s. of Herbert Bennett. Educ. Charterhouse ; Commoner of Magdalen, Oct. 1913-14. Address : Albyfield,Bickley,Kent. War Service : Capt., Rifle Brigade ; employed Ministry of Munitions. www02.us.archive.org/stream/magdalencolleger00magduoft/ma...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Basil Hastings Bennett born 1894 in Brentford, married 1922 to Cecily U Howell in Kingston.  Death of a Basil H Bennett age 71 registered 1st qr 1966 in Surrey S.W.
Cecily Ynys Howell birth registered 3rd qr 1898 in Kingston 
Source: FreeBMD

comment.author: 13706945@N00
comment._content: There are several mentions in the London Gazette, including an Emergency Commission in the King`s Royal Rifle Corps in 1940. London Gazette, 1 December 1914, p. 41: “War Office, 1st December, 1914. REGULAR FORCES. […] The undermentioned to be temporary Second Lieutenants. Dated 27th November, 1914:-- INFANTRY. [...] Dated 27th November, 1914. […] Basil Hastings Bennett.” www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/28992/pages/10196/ London Gazette, 10 March 1915, p. 2468: “War Office, 10th March, 1915. REGULAR FORCES. […] The Rifle Brigade (The Prince Consort's Own). 15th Battalion— The undermentioned temporary Second Lieutenants to be temporary Lieutenants: — Dated 29th January, 1915. […] Basil H. Bennett.” www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29095/supplements/2468/ London Gazette, 10 November 1915, p. 11141: “War Office, I0th November, 1915. REGULAR FORCES. […] The Rifle Brigade (The Prince Consort's Own). The undermentioned temporary Lieutenants, from a Reserve Battalion, to be temporary Lieutenants. Dated 12th August, 1915, but with seniority from the dates specified against their names: — Robert C. Cumberbatch. 26th November, 1914. Henry Tryon. 16th December, 1914. Basil H. Bennett. 29th January, 1915. William C. F. V. Barker-Mill. 3rd February, 1915.” www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29361/supplements/11141/ London Gazette, 6 April 1916, p. 3681: “War Office, 6th April, 1916. REGULAR FORCES. INFANTRY. Service Battalions. […] The Rifle Brigade (The Prince Consort's Own). The undermentioned temporary Lieutenants to be temporary Captains: -- […] Basil H. Bennett. Dated from 30th August, 1915, to 23rd November, 1915, inclusive.” www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/29537/supplements/3681/ London Gazette, 22 November 1940, p. 6680: “War Office, 22nd November, 1940. [...] REGULAR ARMY. EMERGENCY COMMISSIONS, ETC. […] INFANTRY. […] K.R.R.C. Basil Hastings BENNETT (80111) to be Lt. 13th Aug. 1940.” www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/34997/supplements/6680/

comment.author: 13706945@N00
comment._content: That Great War Forum page suggests that he later became Chairman of the Hyde Park Hotel (although it cites no sources): 1914-1918.invisionzone.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=790... There is definitely some connection, however, with the hotel trade: The Directory of Directors for 1921 (Google Books snippet), p. 120: "Bennett.-- Mr. Basil H. Bennett, Little Paddock, Chobham, Surrey, is a director of the-- Queen Anne Residential Mansions and Hotel Company, Limited."
